translation.en: "Okay, who is he?" And at the same time,
I was being friendly with him because he was funny, and I just thought,
translation.ko: 그래도 저는 친절하게 대해 줬어요 재미있는 사람이었거든요

translation.en: "Okay. This is a unique pairing, fine. So…" [chuckles]
translation.ko: 저는 이렇게 생각했죠 '특이한 조합이지만 뭐 어때'

translation.en: Who am I to judge?
But it was just all very mysterious.
And Sarma didn't really tell us either what was going on.
translation.ko: 사르마도 우리한테 도통 이야기를 안 해서

translation.en: So the mystery just… It was all just mystery, that we're like,
translation.ko: 계속 그렇게 모든 게 안개 속에 가려져 있었죠

translation.en: "Okay, we'll just go with this. It's super weird."
translation.ko: 우린 그냥 장단을 맞췄지만 너무 이상했어요

translation.en: He was always very mysterious about who he was,
what his occupation was.
He was involved in some sort of like black ops.
translation.ko: 일종의 비밀 군사 작전에 관련돼 있었어요

translation.en: Stuff that's under the radar that nobody writes about
that's kind of unofficial.
And he would never answer anything directly and made me almost feel like
translation.ko: 뭐든 똑바로 대답하는 적이 없어서 제 안전을 위해 묻지 않아야 할 것 같았죠

translation.en: for my own protection, I shouldn't ask.
translation.ko: 제 안전을 위해 묻지 않아야 할 것 같았죠

translation.en: His computer was very password protected.
I would walk in, and he would hide something.
translation.ko: 제가 방에 들어가면 보던 걸 숨겼어요

translation.en: Or upon his laptop, it was like a seal
translation.ko: 그의 노트북 화면에는 문장 같은 게 있었는데

translation.en: that looked like it was a seal of the CIA or something,
translation.ko: 꼭 CIA를 나타내는 문장처럼 생겼고 "중앙 정보국 비밀번호"

translation.en: and he had to put in a passcode.
I walked in one time, and there was some drone footage that he had to review.
translation.ko: 한번은 방에 들어갔더니 드론 영상 같은 걸 보고 있었어요

translation.en: We referenced traveling, and being in various places,
translation.ko: 우린 여행하고 여기저기 다닌 이야기를 했는데

translation.en: and he referred to having an assistant and a driver.
He would wear a Rolex. I saw him in a Bentley at one point.
translation.ko: 롤렉스를 차고 다니고 한 번은 벤틀리 탄 것도 봤어요

translation.en: [Sarma] One time, we drove into Midtown, and he had me sit in the car.
translation.ko: 한번은 미드타운에 갔는데 저더러 차에서 기다리랬어요

translation.en: He went into some building and then came out a while later,
translation.ko: 어떤 건물에 들어갔다가 한참 후에 나왔는데

translation.en: and he had like a little… one of those tiny manila envelopes
full of loose diamonds.
translation.ko: 그 안에 다이아몬드가 잔뜩 들어 있었죠

translation.en: It was sort of implied that it came from some evidence locker.
[man] I got the impression he was very wealthy.
I didn't ask him, "So, how much money do you have?"
translation.ko: 재산이 얼마나 되느냐고 직접 묻진 않았어요 "존 멜른가일리스 사르마의 아버지"

translation.en: I tiptoed around the question to asking sort of what his career was,
translation.ko: 아주 조심스럽게 무슨 일에 종사하냐고 물었어요

translation.en: what did he do for a living, and then that's how I got the answer.
translation.ko: 생계 수단이 뭐냐고 물었더니 대답해 주더군요

translation.en: Okay. It was black ops. And I tried to probe a little bit.
translation.ko: 비밀 군사 작전이라고 대답하기에 조금 더 캐물었어요

translation.en: Uh, I said, "Do you mean like Blackwater?"
And he said, "Oh, yeah, yeah, that's… It's like that."
[Bonnie] I kind of thought, like, "I don't wanna know too, too much about…
translation.ko: 저는 너무 많은 걸 알고 싶진 않았어요

translation.en: whatever they've got going on or… him."
But that was fine 'cause he didn't want to reveal too much, it seemed like, anyway.
translation.ko: 어차피 그도 많은 걸 숨기려고 했으니까 상관없었죠

translation.en: One night at the bar, though,
he said to me, "Bonnie, I just want to get out of the mud and blood."
[Sarma] There was something he said once about,
"I do what I do so people like you can sleep at night."
translation.ko: '당신 같은 사람들이 잘 수 있게 내가 할 일을 하는 거야'

translation.en: Like in an almost superhero-ish, like, out in the middle of the night
he'd go conquer the evil forces.
It was this underworld that he was connected to,
and super elusive and, like, vague and, like, you know, confusing.
[Allen] This idea that he had this background in the spy agencies or in the military,
translation.ko: 그가 첩보 기관이나 군대에서 일했다는 주장이

translation.en: in and of itself is impossible to disprove, right?
You can look up if he was in the army or something,
but there's no, like, database where you can look up secret agents.
translation.ko: 비밀 요원을 찾아볼 수 있는 데이터베이스는 없거든요

translation.en: [Sarma] I did feel like I was in a relationship with him.
But he lived in Massachusetts. He was sort of in and out.
translation.ko: 그는 매사추세츠에서 살았고 제 삶에 들락날락했어요

translation.en: I wouldn't hear from him for a couple of days.
And then he'd be back,
and I'd be relieved to hear from him again.
But I was always confused and sort of trying to figure things out.
translation.ko: 하지만 늘 혼란스러워서 상황을 이해하려고 애썼어요

translation.en: I don't remember the first time he asked me
translation.ko: 그가 언제 처음으로 현금을 달라고 했는지

translation.en: to give him cash,
but at some point, he did.
He suddenly needed whatever it was, six thousand, ten thousand dollars.
Right away, he just needed it.
It was like life or death. He had to have it.
translation.ko: 생사가 걸린 것처럼 꼭 필요하다고 했죠

translation.en: I was… It's my nature to be like, "Oh, yes. Please, let me help." [laughs]
translation.ko: 저는 천성이 원래 그래요 '그래, 내가 도와줄게'

translation.en: I don't know. So, um…
So, whatever it was, I gave him what he asked for.
translation.ko: 얼마를 요구하든 저는 달라는 대로 줬어요

translation.en: [Ilze] Sarma is unbelievably generous.
translation.ko: 사르마는 믿을 수 없을 만큼 인정이 넘쳐요

translation.en: When I was in university, Sarma was 14, so she came up to visit.
translation.ko: 제가 대학에 다닐 때 14살이던 사르마가 저를 보러 왔죠

translation.en: And in Montreal, there were a lot of young people
translation.ko: 몬트리올 거리에는 거의 노숙자처럼 사는 젊은이가 많았어요

translation.en: who were quasi-homeless and on the street,
and she was just giving money to everybody.
translation.ko: 사르마는 그 사람들한테 다 돈을 줬어요

translation.en: [chuckles] She was walking down the sidewalk,
and she was so sort of taken by all these people in need.
translation.ko: 도움이 필요한 사람들한테 너무 감정 이입을 하기에

translation.en: And I had to say,
"Sarma, you can't give money to every person."
translation.ko: '만나는 사람마다 다 돈을 줄 순 없어'

translation.en: "We're out on Saturday night. Give money to a few people."
translation.ko: '토요일 밤에 놀러 나왔으니까 몇 명에게만 줘'

translation.en: She was just really touched, I guess, by what she saw.
translation.ko: 사르마는 그들 처지를 보고 마음이 안 좋았던 거예요

translation.en: I've known Sarma for about nine years because Leon's nine.
translation.ko: 리언이 아홉 살이니까 사르마를 안 지 9년 됐네요 "앤서니 카루아나 사르마의 친구"

translation.en: I watch everybody goes by. I try to make eye contact with everybody.
translation.ko: 저는 행인들을 보며 모두와 눈을 맞추려고 해요

translation.en: One day, she went by and, like, our eyes connected and she smiled.
translation.ko: 어느 날 사르마가 지나가는데 눈이 마주치자 웃는 거예요

translation.en: And I just… did that, you know what I mean?
And we started talking.
So she told me, you know, some things about herself,
and I told her the reason why I was homeless.
translation.ko: 저도 왜 노숙자가 됐는지 이야기해 줬죠

translation.en: From there, it just became a really good friendship.
Sarma started bringing around this man that she said she had met on the street,
translation.ko: 사르마가 길에서 만난 남자를 데려오기 시작했어요

translation.en: who kind of took a liking to Leon, her dog.
And so Anthony just kind of…
He would come by and hang out with Sarma in the garden. They'd have lunch.
translation.ko: 정원에서 사르마와 이야기하고 함께 점심을 먹었어요

translation.en: He ended up coming to one of our staff Thanksgivings.
translation.ko: 우리 직원 추수감사절 만찬에도 오게 됐죠

translation.en: I respect Sarma because she gets along with everybody.
translation.ko: 사르마를 존경해요 모든 사람과 잘 어울리거든요

translation.en: She would put my stuff in her apartment.
Yeah, she would store my winter clothes, so I didn't have to have it all summer.
translation.ko: 겨울옷을 보관해 줘서 여름에 갖고 다닐 필요가 없었죠

translation.en: She put something into my heart that nobody else ever did.
translation.ko: 제 가슴에 뭔가를 심어 줬는데 여태 그런 사람은 없었죠

translation.en: -Yeah. -[interviewer] What is that?
I can't explain.
-[interviewer] Try. -I just can't explain it.
Nobody can make me do that.
Don't ask me to try.
Some things got to be secret, right?
translation.ko: 어떤 건 비밀로 묻어 둬야 해요

translation.en: The first time I saw Shane,
he was slumped in a chair in her apartment.
I said my usual, "If you need me, don't hesitate to call me."
translation.ko: 제가 평소처럼 말했어요 '제가 필요하면 언제든 부르세요'

translation.en: And he stuck his fat head out and said,
"She's got me. That's why I'm here," and smiled at me.
translation.ko: '사르마한테는 내가 있어요 그래서 내가 있죠', 그리고 웃었죠

translation.en: Didn't introduce himself.
I left the apartment…
with, like, the hairs on the back of my neck standing up,
saying, "Who the fuck was that?"
Nothing nice about him.
And that's where the red flag started popping up.
Friends of mine that worked over at the corporate office,
he was over there more often, and they were so wary of him.
translation.ko: 그 사람이 뻔질나게 드나드는 데다 아주 의심스럽다고 했어요

translation.en: One time he called, and it was him,
but the caller ID said, "Anthony Strangis."
We had never heard that name before.
So we were kind of curious as to what it was.
Um, and we googled Anthony Strangis.
First thing that shows up is his mug shot.
So we learned that Shane Fox was not Shane Fox,
translation.ko: 그래서 그의 본명이 셰인 폭스가 아니란 걸 알게 됐죠

translation.en: and he was Anthony Strangis.
[Joey] Other employees were talking about,
you know, "He's shady. He's been in jail."
translation.ko: 수상하다는 둥 감옥에 갔다 왔다는 둥

translation.en: People were like looking into him. They feared him.
translation.ko: "매너티 카운티 보안관실 체포 보고서" 사람들이 그의 신상을 캐고 두려워 했어요

translation.en: They brought that information up to Sarma,
and she just…
either didn't want to hear it or dismissed it.
translation.ko: 듣고 싶지 않았나 봐요 인정하기 싫었을 수도 있고요

translation.en: I didn't really understand.
And Sarma kind of gives us like a nothing story of, you know,
"It's fine. It's something that was in the past."
There is a part of you that's like, "Okay, you know, people make mistakes."
translation.ko: 한편으로는 그런 생각이 들었죠 '그래, 사람은 실수하잖아'

translation.en: "I don't really know the story. I don't know what happened."
translation.ko: 저는 전말을 모르고 무슨 일이 있었는지도 모르잖아요

translation.en: Maybe this is why he came to New York,
to help, you know, move past whatever had taken place before.
[Sarma] There was some arrest record with his real name and a mug shot
translation.ko: 그의 본명과 피의자 사진이 붙은 체포 기록이 있었는데

translation.en: that somebody sent to me.
I think I was alarmed at first, and then he explained to me
that he had had various identities,
and had multiple identities based on whatever he did.
translation.ko: 하는 일에 따라 다양한 신분으로 위장한다고 했죠 "경찰관 사칭 혐의, 중범죄"

translation.en: He had some situation that had happened in Florida
that he was trying to get sorted out.
translation.ko: 해결하려 애쓰고 있다고 했어요 "머리 위로 배지를 들고"

translation.en: [interviewer] Did you, from then on, did you call him Anthony or Shane?
translation.ko: "매사추세츠 경관이라고 말한 후 자리를 떴다" 그때부터 앤서니라고 불렀어요? 셰인이라고 불렀어요?

translation.en: Or how did things change?
You know, originally, I knew him as Shane.
So I kind of thought of him as that… that way,
more often.
Jim and myself were, you know,
trying to allude that, you know, you have support.
Like, you know, if you need us to come and talk to us,
translation.ko: 필요하면 우리가 찾아가서 얘기도 들어 주고

translation.en: we can help you in any way, shape, or form.
But, um, we were kind of in the dark
about what was going on with them too.
I think after a few months, I got frustrated and angry
translation.ko: 몇 달이 지나자 화나고 좌절감이 느껴졌어요

translation.en: and felt like I was no longer in a relationship with him,
translation.ko: 그와 관계를 유지한다는 느낌이 들지 않았죠

translation.en: or at least from my perspective.
I don't know whether I was confused or angry or what,
but I was just sort of fed up with all the confusion.
I said to myself, like, "Ugh, that's it."
You know, "I'm not letting him come back. I'm not gonna see him again."
translation.ko: 다시는 만나거나 받아 주지 않기로 결심했어요

translation.en: I had gone to my mother's in New Hampshire for a while.
translation.ko: 한동안 뉴햄프셔주의 어머니 집에 가 있었어요

translation.en: I wasn't feeling well, and she had to go somewhere,
translation.ko: 저는 몸이 안 좋고 엄마는 어디 가셔야 해서

translation.en: and I was going to be alone there.
I'm fine walking down a city street at night by myself,
translation.ko: 도시에서는 밤에 혼자 다녀도 아무렇지 않은데

translation.en: but in the country when there's nobody around, I'm absolutely terrified.
He was offering to come and stay with me,
and get me and Leon, and bring us back to New York. And so, I was like…
translation.ko: 나랑 리언을 다시 뉴욕에 데려다주겠다고 하대요, 저는…

translation.en: [sighs] I don't wanna, you know, restart this thing, but, like…
[groans] …it'd be great to have somebody offering to drive me back.
translation.ko: 엄마 집에 함께 있다가 뉴욕에 태워다 주면 좋으니까

translation.en: So, like, "Fine, okay."
Um, and his father drove us back from New Hampshire to New York.
translation.ko: 그의 아버지가 뉴햄프셔에서 뉴욕까지 태워다 주셨어요

translation.en: I met his father who backed up everything that he said about himself,
translation.ko: 그의 아버지를 만났는데 그가 한 말을 다 뒷받침해 주기에

translation.en: which was reassuring.
And then he sort of was able to kind of pull me back in again.
translation.ko: 그래서 결국 그 사람한테 다시 끌려들어 갔어요

translation.en: I just remember feeling like he understood me, which meant a lot.
translation.ko: 저를 이해해 주는 것 같아서 정말 큰 힘이 됐어요

translation.en: I feel like he understood I was trying to grow this business
translation.ko: 제가 진심으로 믿는 이 브랜드와 식당을

translation.en: and this brand that I believed in with all my heart,
translation.ko: 키우려고 애쓴다는 걸 이해하는 것 같았어요

translation.en: and this meant everything to me, and I had to overcome all of these things.
translation.ko: 그게 제 삶과 같고 그 모든 걸 극복해야 한다는 걸요

translation.en: And so, it was hard to push that away.
I feel like there were a few times here and there where I would get
translation.ko: 몇 번쯤은 여기저기서 그런 느낌도 들었어요

translation.en: a feeling like this is what was meant to be happening.
translation.ko: 이미 운명적으로 다 정해진 일이라는 느낌요

translation.en: He wanted me to come meet him at Tiffany's one day.
And it was like the very exclusive floor where they bring you champagne.
He had me try on a couple of rings.
translation.ko: 반지를 몇 개 껴 보라고 했어요

translation.en: He had me try on a ring that cost 800,000 dollars.
This salesperson is treating us like royalty and taking us around.
translation.ko: 점원이 우릴 왕족처럼 대하며 여기저기 안내했어요

translation.en: And like, "What do you like here?" And I'm like, "Why are we here?"
translation.ko: 뭐가 맘에 드냐고 물어보는데 저는 여기 왜 왔느냐고 물었죠

translation.en: And he's like, "Tell me what you like in here."
translation.ko: 그는 이랬죠 '마음에 드는 걸 골라 봐' "사르마의 일기"

translation.en: Tiffany's is not that far away from the St. Regis.
translation.ko: 티파니는 세인트레지스 호텔에서 그리 멀지 않아요

translation.en: I just knew the King Cole Bar to be a nice place.
translation.ko: 저는 킹 콜 바가 근사하단 걸 알아서

translation.en: So we went there to have a drink.
Suddenly, it was like I felt something in my heart.
translation.ko: 그때 갑자기 가슴이 뭉클해지는 걸 느꼈어요

translation.en: So I had this sort of moment of feeling like I loved him.
translation.ko: 그 순간 그 사람을 사랑한다는 느낌을 받았고

translation.en: So I said that.
He'd always want me to remember that feeling going forward.
translation.ko: 그 뒤로 늘 저더러 그 감정을 기억하라고 했어요

translation.en: So that's why subsequently he would always say to me,
"Remember how you felt at the King Cole Bar."
translation.ko: '킹 콜 바에서 느꼈던 그 마음을 기억해'

translation.en: And then he started having us look at houses to buy.
He has me looking at entire townhouses,
and in particular, there was one on 15th Street,
just two blocks south of the restaurant.
The completely gut renovation townhouse,
I think it was listed at 15 million dollars.
Just so happened the broker was the same one
who had sold Alec his apartment on 10th Street, which was like,
translation.ko: 10번가의 알렉 볼드윈 집을 팔아 준 사람이었어요

translation.en: "Oh, here we go again, another odd connection."
He showed something or assured the broker that, you know, he had all the funds.
translation.ko: 그는 중개인에게 뭔가를 보여 주며 돈이 있다고 안심시켰어요 "개인 자산 목록 미화 2,200만 달러"

translation.en: He told me that he had money in various countries stashed away.
translation.ko: "개인 자산 목록 미화 2,200만 달러" 저한테도 여러 나라에 돈을 숨겨 뒀다고 했거든요

translation.en: his biggest client ever,
and that we were gonna be buying buildings and, like, a property upstate.
translation.ko: 우리가 주 북부의 부동산과 빌딩을 살 것처럼요 "이탈리아 베니스의 아파트 현금 가치: 미화 400만 달러"

translation.en: He said, "Let's make an offer."
And then he set us up with some private bankers at Barclays.
translation.ko: 바클리 은행에서 금융 자산 운용가와 약속을 잡았죠

translation.en: We show up. There's this big fancy conference room.
translation.ko: 그곳에 갔더니 커다란 고급 회의실로 안내하고

translation.en: They're offering us all kinds of things.
He's some high-roller client that they're just dying to get.
translation.ko: 그는 은행이 잡으려고 하는 고액 자산가였던 거예요

translation.en: So we had a contract that we were going back and forth
translation.ko: 그래서 부동산을 계약할 때 부동산 변호사와 주고받을

translation.en: with the real estate attorney on, you know, contract points.
translation.ko: 그래서 부동산을 계약할 때 부동산 변호사와 주고받을 계약서를 작성했어요

translation.en: But then, after a while, the funds never materialized.
translation.ko: 그런데 시간이 지나도 자금이 들어오지 않았죠

translation.en: He said that there's some issues,
and for him to get that money, it was gonna take longer than he thought, so
translation.ko: 그 돈이 들어오려면 생각보다 오래 걸릴 거랬어요

translation.en: we didn't get that townhouse.
At that point, I was kind of generally exhausted
from years of feeling
like I was going through all kinds of struggles on my own.
And I didn't have a business partner.
I was in this position of having an enormous amount of debt.
I just wanted kind of out from under all of that.
I completely fallen off of any regular payment schedule with Jeffrey.
translation.ko: 제프리와의 정기 결제 일정도 전혀 지킬 수가 없어서

translation.en: So I was like, every once in a while, bringing him a check for, like, ten grand,
you know, when I could.
Jeffrey was supportive
of whatever I was doing, and what I wanted to do,
and I just always wanted him to be proud of me.
I didn't ever want to disappoint him in any way.
translation.ko: 어떤 식으로든 실망하게 하고 싶지 않았죠

translation.en: [Jeffrey] If she said to me,
"I don't have the money because of x, y, z,"
and it made sense, I believed her, and I trusted her.
translation.ko: 그게 수긍이 가면 저는 사르마를 믿고 신뢰했어요

translation.en: Anthony would tell me that that two-million-dollar debt
that I'd taken on to buy the restaurant, that's nothing.
He'd just take care of that, make that go away.
So he would be there with me and help, you know,
support me to do all the things I wanted to do.
translation.ko: 하고 싶은 걸 할 수 있게 지원해 주겠다고 했죠

translation.en: You know, I would be protected,
at least in one significant way, financially.
And I remember thinking that would be like
some sort of dream come true.
I remember asking the accountant,
"Would he be able to just give me that money?"
translation.ko: '그가 저한테 그 돈을 그냥 줄 수 있나요?'

translation.en: "Or would that be taxable, and how could we do that?"
And, um, he sort of jokingly but half-seriously said,
translation.ko: 회계사는 농담 반, 진담 반 이렇게 말하더군요

translation.en: "You should just marry him."
"And then he can give you the money without it being taxable situation."
translation.ko: '그럼 증여세를 내지 않고 돈을 그냥 줄 수 있어요'

translation.en: Very quickly, in the next day,
we went and got the license. You have to wait 24 hours. Like, boom,
twenty-four hours, we did it and got married.
We got married in November of 2012.
So it was close to a year that I had known him.
translation.ko: 그를 안 지 거의 1년 됐을 때였죠

translation.en: There was a little… not a ceremony, but we had to hire somebody to do it,
translation.ko: 성대한 결혼식은 아니지만 주례를 고용해야 했어요

translation.en: and it was in Tompkins Square Park.
It was a rainy day, and we were under our umbrellas.
That felt a bit romantic getting married because it just…
I don't know. It's hard not to.
And the woman who married us,
her little talk that she gave was incredibly sweet and romantic.
translation.ko: 아주 달콤하고 낭만적인 축사를 해 주셨어요

translation.en: And so I sort of felt in the moment.
[Nick] Sarma G-chatted me. She was like, "Hey, I'm coming to LA."
translation.ko: 사르마가 LA에 올 거라고 메시지를 보냈더군요

translation.en: I picked her up from the airport. She gets in. We're laughing.
translation.ko: 공항에 가서 차에 태웠고 우린 막 웃었어요

translation.en: And on the way home, she, like, shows me her wedding ring.
translation.ko: 그런데 집에 오는 길에 결혼반지를 보여 주더라고요 "어제 LA 공항에 마중 온 닉의 차를 타고"

translation.en: She's like, "I got married."
And I was like, "Oh my God. Congratulations."
I, I mean, I had no idea.
And then she goes on to say how she met this guy, and he's very cool.
translation.ko: 그 남자를 어떻게 만났는지 얼마나 멋진지 얘기하더군요

translation.en: And then she says, "I haven't told anyone at the restaurant yet."
translation.ko: 그런데 아직 식당 직원들에게는 알리지 않았다는 거예요

translation.en: And it makes me go like,
"What? Why?" Like, wha…
If you're with someone, and you agree to get married to them,
don't you want essentially the people that care about you to know?
translation.ko: 당연히 날 아끼는 사람들한테 알리고 싶지 않나요?

translation.en: It was very specific.
She never told me she was getting married.
It was like a non-event. It was kind of…
You might think it's peculiar, but, you know, it's like…
translation.ko: 이상하게 생각할 수도 있지만 그건 마치…

translation.en: Yeah, there's no celebration.
I thought, "Damn, you could do better than that, you know."
translation.ko: 겨우 그렇게밖에 못 하나 싶어서 딸애한테 실망스러웠어요

translation.en: One night, I was at the restaurant,
and Shane texted me that they had gotten married.
And it sounded romantic.
And on one level, I'm like, "Well, he sounds excited."
translation.ko: 한편으로는 셰인이 들뜬 것 같다고 느꼈어요

translation.en: And I want to be. But all along, it had been like,
translation.ko: 저도 그러고 싶었지만 내내 이런 생각이 들었죠

translation.en: "Sarma, what's… You're not… What is happening?"
So I think I texted her because I wanted to confirm this,
and she confirmed it with zero excitement.
translation.ko: 전혀 들뜬 기색 없이 그렇다고 답문을 보냈더군요

translation.en: She had this awesome ring. I think it's on her book cover,
translation.ko: 사르마한테 멋진 반지가 있었어요 책 표지에 실렸던 거예요

translation.en: this ring that I loved that had all these dangling things.
translation.ko: 늘어지는 장식이 달려서 제가 좋아했던 반지죠

translation.en: It was Latvian. She's Latvian. And I always complimented her on it.
translation.ko: 라트비아 장식인데 사르마도 라트비아계라 늘 칭찬했죠

translation.en: And then one day, I noticed she had it on her ring finger at the restaurant,
translation.ko: 어느 날 보니까 그 반지를 넷째 손가락에 꼈더라고요

translation.en: and I sort of kiddingly…
I was hoping I was kidding, but kind of knew that I wasn't,
translation.ko: 농담이길 바랐지만 사실은 아니란 걸 알면서 물었어요

translation.en: and I said, "Oh, did you put that ring there to distract from your wedding ring?"
And she was like, "Yes."
As a couple, they weren't really like a couple, you know?
Like they never, like, held hands. They weren't really affectionate.
translation.ko: 손을 잡지도 않고 애정 표현도 전혀 안 했어요

translation.en: What? Like, you guys got married?
Like, it was like a big, like, surprise for everybody.
It didn't feel like a love story. It was just, you know, kind of weird.
translation.ko: 사랑 이야기 같지 않고 좀 기이했어요

translation.en: There were tons of conspiracy theories about
why she married him, was there some sort of blackmail involved,
translation.ko: 그 남자랑 왜 결혼했을까? 협박당한 건 아닐까?

translation.en: or what it could possibly be.
[Sarma] He told me that he had some sort of like
translation.ko: 그는 자기가 정부의 비밀 군사 조직에 소속된 요원이라고 했어요

translation.en: underground government official military affiliation.
translation.ko: 정부의 비밀 군사 조직에 소속된 요원이라고 했어요

translation.en: So that now, I would be, like, protected as his wife.
translation.ko: 이제 그의 아내로서 저도 보호받는다고 했죠

translation.en: So at some point, he, via email,
introduced me to somebody named Will Richards,
some sort of computer techie expert
that works in the government somewhere in Europe.
[man] Shane and I were working together for years.
There's a lot that I can't divulge.
I was involved in making sure that Sarma didn't go off the rails.
translation.ko: 저는 사르마가 탈선하지 않도록 단속하는 일을 맡았어요 "윌 리처즈 앤서니의 동료"
